business.headline: 10 major financial rule changes from April 1: Tax, UPI updates and moreFrom April 1, you won't have to pay income tax if your annual income is up to Rs 12 lakh. Also, with a standard deduction of Rs 75,000, income up to Rs 12.75 lakh is tax-free under the new tax system.

Ratan Tata's will: Charity gets most, but family, staff, and pets includedRatan Tata will: The industrialist, who died on October 9, 2024, left most of his wealth, including shares in Tata Sons, to charitable causes. At the same time, he did not forget his family, close friends, staff, and even his beloved pets.
Commercial LPG cylinder prices slashed by Rs 41 from todayWhile the price of commercial LPG cylinders has been reduced, the price of domestic cylinders used by households has not changed.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares hit 10% upper circuit todayVodafone Idea share price: The stock has gained 4.47% in the past five days and 0.27% over the past month. However, it remains 26.45% lower over the past six months and has dropped 46.57% in the last year.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech: Why are IT stocks down today?Shares of IT companies such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys and HCLTech took a big hit during intraday trade. Infosys was down over 2.3%, while HCLTech and TCS fell as much as 1.7% at around 10:10 am.

Ola Electric shares gain 2% after update on March vehicle registrationsOla Electric shares were trading 2.15% higher at Rs 54.11 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at around 9:55 am. The jump in its share price came after the company said there had been an improvement in vehicles registered in March.

Sensex crashes 1,200 points. What's behind the stock market bloodbath?The Sensex and Nifty fell sharply as investors on Dalal Street are worried about the impact of US reciprocal tariffs, which will take effect on April 2.

Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty slips below 23,500 as tariff jitters hit Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 253.38 points to 77,161.54, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 46.80 points to 23,472.55 as of 9:31 am.

Stock market opening on April 1: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty todayStock market today: Market experts believe that the early days of April 2025 will be important for investors due to several key events lined up this month.

Stocks to watch on April 1: Shares in news; IndiGo, Ola, HCLTech, Vodafone IdeaAs markets resume trading, several stocks such as Adani Energy Solutions, IndiGo, Ola Electric, Vodafone Idea, HCLTech among others, are expected to be in focus due to company-specific updates.
Small savings interest rates: Check latest PPF, SSY and othersThe government examines and fixes interest rates on such schemes quarterly, depending on the economic scenario and market situation.

S&P 500, Nasdaq fall to lowest levels in over six months amid tariff worriesUS stocks tumbled to their lowest levels in over six months as worries over new tariffs weighed on investor sentiment. With fears of a global slowdown and rising inflation, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq saw sharp declines.
Credit card spending drops. What's causing Indians to spend less?Big credit card issuers like HDFC Bank, SBI Cards, and ICICI Bank witnessed fewer new customers in February.

US reciprocal tariffs: Will Dalal Street face more turbulence from April 2?US reciprocal tariffs have put Dalal Street on edge as investors brace for potential market swings. With FPIs cautious and auto stocks under pressure, domestic markets could face more turbulence in the near term.

Trump tariffs could hit these 9 stocks. Should you sell?The IT sector is under pressure due to concerns over Trump's trade policies and potential increases in H-1B visa costs. Indian IT firms earn over 50% of their revenue from the US, making them vulnerable to higher hiring costs and reduced outsourcing contracts.

UK's Primark boss resigns after 'error of judgement' in social settingThe group said on Monday that Paul Marchant had cooperated with an investigation led by external lawyers, acknowledged his "error of judgement" and accepted that his actions fell below the standards expected by AB Foods.

Claiming HRA but not paying TDS? Beware of tax notices and penaltiesThe landlord's PAN must be mentioned in the TDS challan. However, if the PAN is missing or inactive, the TDS is levied at 20% under Section 206AA. On the other hand, for Non-Resident Indian (NRI) landlords, the rate of TDS is 30%.

IPO market off to a slow start in FY26, but these 4 firms to debut soonThe IPO pipeline for FY26 could be worth nearly Rs 2 lakh crore. Some major companies, including Zepto, Reliance Jio, and LG Electronics, are reportedly in the process of finalising their listing plans.

Haldiram's to sell stake to Singapore's Temasek, says PwCThis stake sale is expected to help Haldiram expand both in India and internationally, strengthening its position in the highly competitive snacks and packaged foods market.

ATM withdrawals to cost Rs 23 from May 1 as RBI hikes fee. Check detailsATM cash withdrawal will see an increase from the current charge of Rs 21 per transaction. Despite the fee hike, customers will continue to receive a limited number of free ATM transactions every month.

Is stock market closed today for Eid?The stock market follows a five-day workweek, operating from Monday to Friday. Regular trading hours are from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm. Markets remain closed on weekends and designated public holidays as per the official schedule.

IndiGo gets Rs 944 crore tax penalty, calls it erroneous and frivolousBudget carrier IndiGo's parent company said it had received a Rs 944 crore tax penalty order from the Income Tax Department. The company plans to challenge the order legally and called it "frivolous and erroneous".

Sensex, Nifty closing: Top stocks that gained and lost on BSE, NSEIT and auto sector stocks dragged the market down. The fall in IT and auto stocks is linked to concerns over US reciprocal tariffs, which are set to come into effect on April 2.

Thailand stock exchange halts trading after earthquake hits MyanmarFollowing tremors from the Myanmar earthquake, the Stock Exchange of Thailand suspended all trading for the Friday afternoon session.

DA hiked by 2%: Here's how much central government employees will earn nowWith the 2% hike, DA has now risen from 53% to 55%. Pensioners will also experience a similar increase in their Dearness Relief (DR).

Sensex, Nifty end FY25 on a weak note as Trump tariffs weigh on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 191.51 points to close at 77,414.92, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 72.60 points to end at 23,519.35.

How India saw a billionaire boom in just 10 yearsIndia's billionaire club isn't just growing—it's thriving. A decade ago, cracking this list was a rare feat. Now, it's happening faster than ever. Even with market swings and economic headwinds, the country keeps adding new names to its billionaire ranks.

Salary boost for central government employees, DA hiked by 2%With this revision, DA will rise from 53% to 55%, offering a salary boost to employees. The last DA increase took place in July 2024, when it was raised from 50% to 53%.
Missed TDS on rent? Here's what tax department is doingThe law requires tenants to deduct TDS at 2% on rent above Rs 50,000 per month, in case the landlord is a resident Indian.

India offers to lower US farm tariffs, looks to strengthen trade ties: ReportIndia-US trade talk: The government has proposed reducing import duties on several US agricultural products, including almonds, walnuts, cranberries, pistachios, and lentils.

Why is stock market falling today? 3 things investors need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 339.66 points to 77,266.77 at 1:13 pm and the NSE Nifty50 traded 100.45 points lower to trade at 23,491.50. Here are three important points retail investors need to know.

India's billionaires have wealth bigger than Saudi Arabia's GDP. Check detailsIndia's billionaires now have a combined wealth that exceeds the entire economy of Saudi Arabia. India ranks third globally in the number of billionaires, behind the United States and China.

Health insurance rejected? Here are 5 things you need to knowUnderstanding why health insurance claims are rejected is important as it will help you avoid unnecessary stress or financial burden during medical emergencies.

How this scheme can help you save Rs 20 lakh in 15 years for daughterIf you are planning for your daughter's higher education expenses, the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) can be a great savings option.

Razorpay's Shashank Kumar, Harshil Mathur become India's youngest billionairesHarshil Mathur and Shashank Kumar met at IIT Roorkee, where they shared an interest in technology and problem-solving. Their journey into fintech began in 2014 when they launched Razorpay to simplify digital payments in India.
Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade over Trump tariff threats; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 282.59 points to 77,323.84, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 84.70 points to 23,507.25 as of 9:42 am.
Planning a bank transfer on March 31? Here's why it may not workWhile banks will remain open, transactions like fund transfers, cash deposits, and withdrawals may not go through.

Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start on March 6 as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.

entertainment.headline: Spider-Man Beyond the Spider-Verse locks release date, to swing into cinemas in 2027The animated sequel Spider-Man Beyond the Spider-Verse is scheduled to hit theaters on June 4, 2027. Fans are thrilled with the announcement and eagerly await more plot details.

Director Hansal Mehta says he is 'fond' of Kangana Ranaut: We did not get alongHansal Mehta and Kangana Ranaut, who once collaborated on the film Simran, have had a tumultuous relationship marked by public disagreements. However, Mehta mainatained that he is fond of the actor.

Empuraan producer: Not isolating Prithviraj, removed 2 minutes of footageEmpuraan producer Antony Perumbavoor met the media in Kochi on Tuesday. He said that Mohanlal and everyone knew about the film's content before release and that they did not make edits due to external pressure.

Spider-Man Brand New Day: 4th instalment of Tom Holland film gets official titleThe fourth Spider-Man film, titled Spider-Man: Brand New Day, was officially announced at CinemaCon by director Destin Daniel Cretton. The filming is set to start later this summer.

Ekta Kapoor says Naagin 7 is 'coming soon', fans say 'give us a promo already'Producer Ekta Kapoor told the fans on Eid that 'Naagin 7' is in the works, and she will share a legit update soon. Fans asked her to stop with these announcements and share the promo already.

Kerala BJP leader calls Prithviraj's wife urban Naxal amid Empuraan controversyAmid the ongoing controversy surrounding Mohanlal-starrer 'L2: Empuraan', Kerala BJP leader B Gopalakrishnan labelled Prithviraj Sukumaran's wife an 'Urban Naxal' and criticised his mother.

AbRam, Suhana, Navya and others seen outside stadium after MI's win over KKRShah Rukh Khan's children, AbRam, Suhana Khan, her friends, Navya Naveli and several other star kids attended the MI vs KKR match held on March 31 in Mumbai. Shahid Kapoor and Mira Rajput were seen at the stadium as well.

Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor says Bollywood is stuck in past: Need high-concept filmsHarsh Varrdhan Kapoor criticised Bollywood's formulaic films, urging producers to back low-cost, high-concept movies. He promised "unforgettable films" if given support.

The Diplomat actor Sadia Khateeb wants to explore action and work with Salman, SRKThe Diplomat actor Sadia Khateeb, in a conversation with India Today, spoke about exploring action films. She also added that she has an 'endless' list of names in Bollywood she'd want to work with.

Jugal Hansraj on Mohabbatein, SRK's work ethic and film's timeless appealActor Jugal Hansraj recalled memories of working on the 2000 film Mohabbatein and sharing the screen with SRK. He remembered Yash Chopra's presence on set and praised Shah Rukh's team-first approach to filmmaking.

Pics: Kiran Rao, Reena Dutta click selfie at Aamir Khan's family gathering on EidKiran Rao celebrated Eid with Aamir Khan's family on Monday. She shared heartwarming pictures from the festivities on social media. While Aamir was missing from her photos, he earlier greeted paparazzi with his sons.

Fahadh Faasil and Vadivelu's Maareesan eyes July release. New poster outActors Fahadh Faasil and Vadivelu's upcoming film, 'Maareesan', will hit theatres in a few months. The makers released a new poster announcing the month of release.

Sikandar box office Day 2: Salman's film sees minimal Eid boost, earns Rs 55 croreSikandar box office collection: Salman Khan's film collected Rs 29 crore on Eid, bringing its India total to Rs 55 crore. Despite the festive boost, it remains the actor's weakest Eid opener, facing strong competition from Mohanlal's L2: Empuraan.

Empuraan box office Day 5: Mohanlal film is Kerala's fastest Rs 50-crore grosserMohanlal and director Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'L2: Empuraan' grossed Rs 50 crore in Kerala in just five days. The film minted Rs 200 crore worldwide and is still going strong.

Salman Khan only follows Dharmendra after his father, wants to remake his 3 filmsBollywood superstar Salman Khan recently revealed his admiration for veteran actor Dharmendra, stating he follows him more than Dharmendra's own sons. Salman also expressed interest in remaking three of Dharmendra's iconic films.

Ananya Panday performs at Wankhede ahead of MI vs KKR match, father Chunky reactsActor Ananya Panday lit up the Wankhede Stadium with her dance performance before the IPL match between KKR and MI. Her energetic moves thrilled Bollywood fans and added glamour to the cricket event.

Nothing, just Ed Sheeran vibing with Indian auto driver to new song AzizamSinger Ed Sheeran is set to release his first single of 2025, Azizam, soon. Ahead of the release, he shared a video from his visit to India, where he is seen vibing to the track's lyrics with an autorickshaw driver during a ride.

L2 Empuraan races past Chhaava to become 2025's fastest Rs 200 crore grosserMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan raced past the box office records of Vicky Kaushal's Chhaava to become the fastest film to enter the Rs 200 crore club. The film hit theatres on March 27.

Sardar 2 teaser: Karthi takes on 'Black Dagger' SJ Suryah in PS Mithran's sequelThe teaser of Sardar 2, starring Karthi, was unveiled on Eid 2025. The clip introduces SJ Suryah as the main antagonist, who takes on the Indian spy Sardar, played by Karthi.

Amid PM Modi retirement claim, what Yogi Adityanath said about his political futureRegarding his political future, Yogi Adityanath played it close to the chest. He acknowledged that his time at the helm of UP comes with an expiry date but refused to elaborate on what's next for him.
How does India look from space? Sunita Williams answersWilliams expressed excitement about reconnecting with India and her enthusiasm for India's growing role in space exploration.

Khamenei adviser's ominous 'no choice but to get nukes' warning amid US standoffIran would have "no choice" but to acquire a nuclear weapon if attacked by the United States or its allies, an adviser to the country's supreme leader warned following Donald Trump's bombing threat.

Liver Doc calls biohacker Bryan Johnson a fraud. He hits backDr. Cyriac Abby Philips, known as The Liver Doc on X, has accused Bryan Johnson of scamming people with his longevity program called Blueprint.

Trump's 'very kind' message ahead of tariff deadline: What's in store for India?US President Donald Trump, who vowed to impose reciprocal tariffs on all US trade partners, said that he could make the announcement as early as Tuesday night or Wednesday morning.
Sam Altman reacts to Ghibli-style images of PM ModiSam Altman reacted to the Government of India's social media post featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi in a Ghibli-style animation.

Don't know if child's mine or not…: Elon Musk claims he paid influencer millionsElon Musk denied allegations from influencer Ashley St Clair that he reduced child support payments for their alleged son. In response to his claim, St Clair accused the tech billionaire of refusing a paternity test.

Yogi Adityanath says Tamil, Telugu being taught in UP, Congress seeks dataThis is the second time in a week that the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister has taken potshots at MK Stalin over the language row, accusing him of furthering his political interests.

Virat Kohli to play in BBL? Sydney Sixers make big announcement on April 1The Sydney Sixers decided to have some fun at the expense of cricket fans as they announced the signing of Virat Kohli for the next two seasons of the Big Bash League on Tuesday, April 1.

Redrawing the fault lines: Why delimitation may ignite Manipur againThe Supreme Court-mandated process in the violence-hit state faces political opposition over flawed data, illegal immigration and ethnic tensions, turning it into a flashpoint

After Columbia, Harvard under antisemitism scrutiny, faces funding risksA federal antisemitism task force is reviewing more than USD 255 million in contracts between Harvard and the federal government to make sure the school is following civil rights laws, the administration announced Monday.

Pay up for waste disposal in Bengaluru as garbage tax kicks in from todayFrom today, April 1, 2025, the Bengaluru civic body, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, will begin charging for waste management in the city. The charges would be based on the building area.

Please be brutally honest with us, says Intel's new CEO Lip-Bu Tan to customersIn his first comments as Intel's new CEO on Monday, Lip-Bu Tan described a streamlined vision for the company, emphasising direct collaboration with engineers to develop new products informed by customer feedback.

France's Marine Le Pen gets 4 years for embezzlement, with 2 under ankle monitorMarine Le Pen, who was the frontrunner for the 2024 presidential elections, along with more than 20 members of her party, was convicted of paying her party's staff using funds from the European Parliament.

Indian women's team legend Vandana Katariya announces international retirementIndian women's hockey team legend Vandana Katariya has announced her retirement from international hockey on Tuesday, April 1. Katariya is the most capped player in the history of Indian women's hockey.

China conducts military drills near Taiwan, calls its President 'parasite'Taiwan's Defence Ministry said in a statement on Tuesday that China's Shandong aircraft carrier group had entered its response area on Monday, adding the group had dispatched military aircraft and ships and activated land-based missile systems in response.

sports.headline: LSG vs PBKS, pitch, weather report IPL 2025: Low-scoring game expected in Lucknow?The Lucknow Super Giants will welcome the Punjab Kings to the Ekana stadium on Tuesday, April 1 for an exciting clash. How will the weather and pitch conditions be for the first match in Lucknow in IPL 2025?

Hardik Pandya asked the team to raise intensity and be ruthless: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' (MI) wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that their captain Hardik Pandya, had asked the entire team to raise the intensity ahead of their fixture against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). MI beat Kolkata by 8 wickets to register first win of the season.

Ricketon reveals Ashwani Kumar's special trait: He's a lot quicker than he looksMumbai Indians wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton revealed that their new bowler Ashwani Kumar is a lot quicker than people think of him to be. Ashwani registered match-winning figures of 4/24 in three overs on his debut.

Ashwani Kumar is a hardworking guy, we practice at the same academy: Ramandeep SinghKolkata Knight Riders (KKR) all-rounder Ramandeep Singh showered praise on Mumbai Indians' Ashwani Kumar after his match-winning performance in Match 12 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Ashwani became the first Indian player to take four wickets on his IPL debut.

Ramandeep said that every three years, teams have to find new winning combinations.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
